channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Weapons and war: Parallels between Iran and Iraq
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with journalist Steve Coll about the parallels between Iraq and Iran when it comes to discussions of a potential war due to an adversarial country's weapons program.

item.title: The story of an HIV-positive orphan and a pastor's quest to help after U.S. aid cuts
item.description: AIDS orphans and vulnerable children are without support since the U.S. cut foreign assistance. A pastor has been frantically trying to find meds for an HIV-positive orphan who can no longer get them.

item.title: A woman fears her eyesight won't be saved in time due to research grant cuts
item.description: The Trump administration's feud with Harvard has axed research grants. A woman with a rare genetic disorder that causes blindness says crucial research may not be ready in time to save her eyesight.

item.title: Omaha to celebrate Juneteenth with new energy after electing first Black mayor
item.description: Omaha just elected its first Black mayor, giving this year's Juneteenth celebrations new energy. The city wants to mark the occasion by being a model for unity during a time of divisiveness.

item.title: SCOTUS upholds Tenn. law on care barring gender-affirming care for minors
item.description: On Wednesday, the U.S. Supreme Court upheld laws in roughly half the states that ban transgender medical care for minors. The vote was 6-to-3, along ideological lines.

item.title: Iranians flee Tehran
item.description: Some iranians welcomed Israeli attacks on their leaders, but now fear for their own safety. Thousands are scrambling to get out of Tehran as the air war intensifies

item.title: Michigan is trying to restart a nuclear plant â€” something rarely if ever done
item.description: There's renewed interest in using nuclear energy to supply electricity after years of stagnation. Now, Michigan wants to restart a shut down plant. Analysts say in most cases, that won't be possible.

item.title: Israel's president talks with NPR about Iran
item.description: As Israel's war with Iran expands, Israeli President Isaac Herzog called for international support in destroying Iran's main nuclear facilities.

item.title: New details on 300-year-old coins excite researchers
item.description: New pictures of coins from a 300-year-old shipwreck off the coast of Colombia help tell the story of the ship's journey.

item.title: Screen addiction and suicidal behaviors are linked for teens, a study shows
item.description: The study, published in JAMA, followed teens for years and evaluated addictive behaviors, as well as suicidality.
